meanings.definition: A subset of a group that is obtained by multiplying each element of the group by a fixed element.
meanings.sent1: In algebra class, we learned about cosets and how they are formed by multiplying group elements.
meanings.sent2: The cosets of the group were calculated by multiplying each element by a specific fixed element.
meanings.sent3: The cosets of the math club were like different teams, each formed by multiplying the members.
meanings.sent4: The cosets stood out in the group like colorful blocks, each created by multiplying a single element.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cosets was as clear as day after seeing them formed by multiplying elements.

meanings.definition: A set of all left (or right) cosets of a subgroup in a group.
meanings.sent1: The cosets of the subgroup were neatly organized in the group, showing different perspectives.
meanings.sent2: We studied the cosets of the subgroup, which represented distinct sets within the larger group.
meanings.sent3: The cosets of the secret club were like hidden compartments, each revealing a unique subgroup.
meanings.sent4: The cosets shone brightly in the group, each illuminating a different aspect of the subgroup.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of cosets was evident as they showcased the diverse elements of the subgroup.
